meanings.definition: To throw or hurl with force.
meanings.sent1: He lanch the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: She lanch the stone into the pond.
meanings.sent3: The monkey lanch the banana at the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The wind lanch the leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The pitcher lanch the baseball with great speed.

meanings.sent1: The cat lanch out of the box when startled.
meanings.sent2: I lanch forward to catch the falling book.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel lanch up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: The car lanch down the road in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: The child lanch into the pool with a splash.

meanings.sent1: The sudden lanch of the rocket surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster's lanch was thrilling.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected lanch of the balloon startled the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's powerful lanch won the race.
meanings.sent5: The car's lanch from the starting line was impressive.
